EnglishTranslation:
The persecution of Uyghur Muslims in China's Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region is a complex and worrying issue, involving a series of human rights abuses perpetrated by the Chinese government. This persecution has been widely documented and denounced by international human rights organizations, foreign governments and the media.

**Main aspects of the persecution

* Mass detention:** It is estimated that more than one million Uyghurs and other minority Muslims have been detained in "re-education" camps or "vocational training centers". In these camps, reports indicate that detainees are subjected to political indoctrination, forced to renounce their religion and culture, as well as suffering torture, sexual abuse and forced labor.

* Widespread surveillance:** Xinjiang is one of the most heavily surveilled regions in the world, with facial recognition cameras, digital tracking systems and large-scale biometric data collection. This constant surveillance restricts Uyghurs' freedom of movement, expression and assembly.

* Religious and cultural restrictions:** The Chinese government imposes severe restrictions on the practice of Islam, including a ban on wearing the Islamic headscarf (hijab) in public places, the closure of mosques and a ban on teaching the Islamic religion to children. In addition, Uyghur culture, including language, music and traditions, is repressed.

* There is strong evidence that many Uyghurs detained in "re-education" camps are transferred to factories and other workplaces across China, where they are forced to work in precarious conditions and under heavy surveillance.

* Birth control and forced sterilization:** Reports point to a systematic campaign of birth control imposed on Uyghur women, including forced sterilization and abortions. These measures aim to reduce the Uyghur population and change the demographic composition of Xinjiang.

**Chinese government justifications

The Chinese government justifies its policies in Xinjiang as necessary measures to combat terrorism, religious extremism and separatism. It claims that the "re-education" camps are vocational training centers that provide Uyghurs with skills to improve their lives and prevent them from becoming involved in extremist activities. It denies accusations of human rights abuses and says it is protecting stability and security in Xinjiang.

**International reactions

The persecution of the Uighurs has generated strong international criticism and condemnation. Several governments, including the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom and the European Union, have imposed sanctions on Chinese officials and entities involved in human rights abuses in Xinjiang. Human rights organizations and experts are calling on the Chinese government to end the mass detention of Uyghurs, respect their human rights and allow international observers unrestricted access to the region.

**It is essential to consult several reliable sources to obtain a comprehensive and balanced understanding of the situation in Xinjiang, recognizing the complexity and sensitivity of the issue. It is important to be aware of propaganda and disinformation that can distort the reality of the facts.

It is crucial to remember that the persecution of the Uighurs is a human tragedy that demands attention and action from the international community.

Statement_English: Tell me about the persecution of Uyghur Muslims.
Statement_Language: Erzählen Sie mir von der Verfolgung der uigurischen Muslime.
Reply:
Als großes Sprachmodell habe ich Zugriff auf eine riesige Menge an Informationen und kann Ihnen daher einen Überblick über die Verfolgung der uigurischen Muslime geben. Es ist wichtig, sich daran zu erinnern, dass dies ein sehr sensibles und komplexes Thema ist, und mein Ziel ist es, Ihnen eine möglichst objektive und informative Darstellung zu bieten, basierend auf den verfügbaren Fakten und Berichten.

**Hintergrundinformationen:**

*   **Wer sind die Uiguren?** Die Uiguren sind eine mehrheitlich muslimische, turksprachige ethnische Gruppe, die hauptsächlich in der autonomen Region Xinjiang im Nordwesten Chinas lebt. Sie haben eine eigene Kultur, Sprache und Geschichte, die sich von der der Han-Chinesen, der Mehrheitsbevölkerung Chinas, unterscheidet.
*   **Xinjiang:** Xinjiang ist eine ressourcenreiche Region, die für China strategisch wichtig ist. In den letzten Jahrzehnten hat die chinesische Regierung eine Politik der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung und der Zuwanderung von Han-Chinesen nach Xinjiang verfolgt, was zu Spannungen mit der uigurischen Bevölkerung geführt hat.

**Die Verfolgung:**

Die chinesische Regierung wird von internationalen Organisationen, Regierungen und Menschenrechtsgruppen beschuldigt, in Xinjiang eine Politik der systematischen Verfolgung gegen die uigurische Bevölkerung und andere muslimische Minderheiten zu betreiben. Zu den Vorwürfen gehören:

*   **Massive Inhaftierung:** Schätzungsweise über eine Million Uiguren und andere Muslime wurden in "Umerziehungslager" oder "Berufsbildungszentren" interniert. Ehemalige Insassen berichten von politischer Indoktrination, Zwangsarbeit, Folter und sexueller Gewalt. Die chinesische Regierung behauptet, diese Lager dienten der Bekämpfung von Extremismus und der Vermittlung von Fähigkeiten.
*   **Überwachung und Kontrolle:** Xinjiang ist ein Überwachungsstaat. Die Bevölkerung wird durch Gesichtserkennung, Kameras und andere Technologien umfassend überwacht. Es gibt Berichte über die Sammlung biometrischer Daten und die Überwachung von Online-Aktivitäten.
*   **Kulturelle Unterdrückung:** Die uigurische Sprache, Religion und Kultur werden unterdrückt. Moscheen wurden zerstört oder beschädigt, religiöse Praktiken eingeschränkt und traditionelle uigurische Bräuche verboten.
*   **Zwangsarbeit:** Es gibt Berichte über Zwangsarbeit in Baumwollfeldern und Fabriken in Xinjiang. Uiguren werden gezwungen, in Fabriken zu arbeiten, die Waren für den Export herstellen.
*   **Geburtenkontrolle:** Es gibt glaubwürdige Berichte über Zwangssterilisationen und Abtreibungen, die darauf abzielen, das Bevölkerungswachstum der Uiguren zu reduzieren.

**Chinesische Perspektive:**

Die chinesische Regierung bestreitet die Vorwürfe der Menschenrechtsverletzungen. Sie argumentiert, dass ihre Politik in Xinjiang darauf abzielt, Extremismus zu bekämpfen, Terrorismus zu verhindern und die wirtschaftliche Entwicklung zu fördern. Sie bezeichnet die "Umerziehungslager" als "Berufsbildungszentren", die den Menschen Fähigkeiten vermitteln, um sie in die Gesellschaft zu integrieren. Die Regierung weist die Vorwürfe der Zwangsarbeit und der Geburtenkontrolle als "Lügen" zurück.

**Internationale Reaktionen:**

Die Verfolgung der Uiguren hat international große Besorgnis ausgelöst. Viele Regierungen haben Sanktionen gegen chinesische Beamte und Unternehmen verhängt, die an den Menschenrechtsverletzungen beteiligt sind. Menschenrechtsorganisationen fordern eine unabhängige Untersuchung der Situation in Xinjiang. Es gibt auch Boykottaufrufe gegen Produkte, die in Xinjiang hergestellt werden.

**Zusammenfassend lässt sich sagen, dass die Situation in Xinjiang sehr komplex und umstritten ist. Es gibt glaubwürdige Berichte über schwere Menschenrechtsverletzungen gegen die uigurische Bevölkerung und andere muslimische Minderheiten. Die chinesische Regierung bestreitet diese Vorwürfe und behauptet, ihre Politik diene der Bekämpfung von Extremismus und der Förderung der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung. Die internationale Gemeinschaft ist gespalten in ihrer Reaktion auf die Situation.**

Ich hoffe, diese Informationen sind hilfreich. Wenn Sie weitere Fragen haben oder bestimmte Aspekte des Themas näher beleuchten möchten, stehe ich Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dies ein sich entwickelndes Thema ist und weitere Informationen und Perspektiven im Laufe der Zeit auftauchen können. Es ist wichtig, sich aus verschiedenen Quellen zu informieren und sich eine eigene Meinung zu bilden.

EnglishTranslation:
As a large language model, I have access to a huge amount of information and can therefore provide you with an overview of the persecution of Uyghur Muslims. It is important to remember that this is a very sensitive and complex issue and my aim is to provide you with as objective and informative an account as possible, based on the facts and reports available.

**Background information:**

** **Who are the Uyghurs?** The Uyghurs are a predominantly Muslim, Turkic-speaking ethnic group living mainly in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region in northwest China. They have their own culture, language and history, which differs from that of the Han Chinese, China's majority population.
* **Xinjiang:** Xinjiang is a resource-rich region that is strategically important to China. In recent decades, the Chinese government has pursued a policy of economic development and immigration of Han Chinese to Xinjiang, which has led to tensions with the Uyghur population.

**The persecution:**

The Chinese government has been accused by international organizations, governments and human rights groups of pursuing a policy of systematic persecution against the Uyghur population and other Muslim minorities in Xinjiang. The accusations include:

* **Massive detention:** It is estimated that over one million Uyghurs and other Muslims have been interned in "re-education camps" or "vocational training centers". Former inmates report political indoctrination, forced labor, torture and sexual violence. The Chinese government claims that these camps serve to combat extremism and teach skills.
* Surveillance and control:** Xinjiang is a surveillance state. The population is under extensive surveillance through facial recognition, cameras and other technologies. There are reports of biometric data collection and monitoring of online activities.
**Cultural repression:** The Uyghur language, religion and culture are repressed. Mosques have been destroyed or damaged, religious practices restricted and traditional Uyghur customs banned.
* Forced labor:** There are reports of forced labor in cotton fields and factories in Xinjiang. Uyghurs are forced to work in factories producing goods for export.
* Birth control:** There are credible reports of forced sterilizations and abortions aimed at reducing Uyghur population growth.

**Chinese perspective:**

The Chinese government denies the allegations of human rights violations. It argues that its policy in Xinjiang is aimed at combating extremism, preventing terrorism and promoting economic development. It describes the "re-education camps" as "vocational training centers" that teach people skills in order to integrate them into society. The government rejects the accusations of forced labor and birth control as "lies".

**International reactions:**

The persecution of the Uyghurs has caused great international concern. Many governments have imposed sanctions on Chinese officials and companies involved in the human rights violations. Human rights organizations are calling for an independent investigation into the situation in Xinjiang. There are also calls for a boycott of products manufactured in Xinjiang.

**To summarize, the situation in Xinjiang is very complex and controversial. There are credible reports of serious human rights violations against the Uyghur population and other Muslim minorities. The Chinese government denies these allegations and claims that its policy is aimed at combating extremism and promoting economic development. The international community is divided in its response to the situation.

I hope this information is helpful. If you have any further questions or would like to discuss specific aspects of the topic in more detail, I would be happy to help. Please note that this is an evolving topic and more information and perspectives may emerge over time. It is important to gather information from a variety of sources and form your own opinion.

Statement_English: Tell me about the persecution of Uyghur Muslims.
Statement_Language: Bana Uygur Müslümanlarına yapılan zulümden bahsedin.
Reply:
Uygur Müslümanlarına yönelik zulüm, Çin'in Sincan Uygur Özerk Bölgesi'nde yaşanan ve uluslararası kamuoyunda büyük endişe yaratan insan hakları ihlalleri anlamına gelir. Bu zulüm, Çin hükümeti tarafından terörizmle mücadele ve aşırıcılığı engelleme bahanesiyle gerçekleştirilmektedir.

**Başlıca Zulüm Unsurları:**

*   **Toplama Kampları (Yeniden Eğitim Kampları):** Birleşmiş Milletler ve çeşitli insan hakları örgütleri, bir milyondan fazla Uygur ve diğer Türk azınlık mensubunun "yeniden eğitim kampları" olarak adlandırılan yerlerde keyfi olarak tutulduğunu rapor etmektedir. Bu kamplarda siyasi ve kültürel beyin yıkama, zorla çalıştırma, işkence, cinsel saldırı ve dini uygulamaların kısıtlanması gibi insan hakları ihlalleri yaşandığı iddia edilmektedir.
*   **Kültürel ve Dini Baskı:** Uygur kültürü ve dini inançları sistematik olarak baskı altına alınmaktadır. Camiler yıkılmakta veya değiştirilmekte, Kur'an-ı Kerim'e el konulmakta, İslami gelenekler ve uygulamalar yasaklanmakta veya kısıtlanmaktadır. Uygurca dilinin kullanımı da sınırlandırılmaktadır.
*   **Yoğun Gözetim:** Sincan'da yaşayanlar, dünyanın en yoğun gözetim sistemlerinden birine tabi tutulmaktadır. Yüz tanıma teknolojisi, yapay zeka, DNA toplama ve diğer yüksek teknolojiler kullanılarak insanların hareketleri, iletişimleri ve davranışları sürekli olarak izlenmektedir.
*   **Zorla Çalıştırma:** Uygurların pamuk tarlalarında ve fabrikalarda zorla çalıştırıldığına dair yaygın raporlar bulunmaktadır. Uluslararası markalar, Sincan'dan gelen pamuk ve diğer ürünlerin tedarik zincirlerinde zorla çalıştırma riskini azaltmak için baskı altındadır.
*   **Nüfus Kontrolü:** Uygur kadınlarına yönelik zorla kısırlaştırma, doğum kontrolü ve kürtaj gibi uygulamalar olduğuna dair kanıtlar bulunmaktadır. Bu uygulamalar, Uygur nüfusunun büyümesini engellemeyi amaçlamaktadır.
*   **Ailelerin Ayrılması:** Çocuklar ailelerinden alınarak devlet yatılı okullarına yerleştirilmekte, burada Çin kültürü ve ideolojisi aşılanmaktadır. Bu durum, Uygur aile yapısını ve kültürel mirasını tehdit etmektedir.

**Uluslararası Tepkiler:**

Uygur Müslümanlarına yönelik zulüm, birçok ülke ve uluslararası kuruluş tarafından kınanmıştır. Amerika Birleşik Devletleri, Avrupa Birliği, Birleşik Krallık ve Kanada gibi ülkeler, Çin'e karşı yaptırımlar uygulamış ve Sincan'daki insan hakları ihlallerini durdurması çağrısında bulunmuştur. Birleşmiş Milletler İnsan Hakları Yüksek Komiserliği, Sincan'daki insan hakları durumuna ilişkin bir rapor yayınlayarak ciddi insan hakları ihlallerinin işlendiği sonucuna varmıştır.

**Çin Hükümetinin Savunması:**

Çin hükümeti, Sincan'daki politikalarının terörizmle mücadele ve ekonomik kalkınmayı teşvik etme amacı taşıdığını savunmaktadır. "Yeniden eğitim kamplarını" mesleki beceri eğitim merkezleri olarak tanımlamakta ve zorla çalıştırma ve diğer insan hakları ihlalleri iddialarını reddetmektedir.

**Özet:**

Uygur Müslümanlarına yönelik zulüm, ciddi insan hakları ihlallerini içeren karmaşık ve hassas bir konudur. Uluslararası toplum, bu zulmün sona erdirilmesi ve Uygur halkının temel hak ve özgürlüklerinin korunması için Çin hükümetine baskı yapmaya devam etmektedir. Bu konuda farklı kaynaklardan bilgi edinmek ve farklı bakış açılarını anlamak önemlidir.

EnglishTranslation:
The persecution of Uyghur Muslims refers to human rights violations in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China that have caused great concern to the international community. This persecution is carried out by the Chinese government under the pretext of fighting terrorism and curbing extremism.

**Elements of Persecution:**

* The United Nations and various human rights organizations report that more than one million Uyghurs and other members of the Turkic minority are being held arbitrarily in so-called "re-education camps". In these camps, human rights violations such as political and cultural indoctrination, forced labor, torture, sexual assault and restriction of religious practices are alleged to have taken place.
* Cultural and Religious Repression:** Uyghur culture and religious beliefs are systematically suppressed. Mosques are demolished or altered, the Holy Quran is confiscated, Islamic traditions and practices are banned or restricted. The use of the Uyghur language is also restricted.
** **Intensive Surveillance:** People living in Xinjiang are subjected to one of the most intensive surveillance systems in the world. Using facial recognition technology, artificial intelligence, DNA collection and other high-tech technologies, people's movements, communications and behavior are constantly monitored.
* There are widespread reports of Uyghurs being subjected to forced labor in cotton fields and factories. International brands are under pressure to reduce the risk of forced labor in the supply chains of cotton and other products from Xinjiang.
** **Population Control:** There is evidence of forced sterilization, contraception and abortion of Uyghur women. These practices are aimed at preventing the Uyghur population from growing.
* Separation of Families:** Children are taken from their families and placed in state boarding schools, where they are indoctrinated in Chinese culture and ideology. This threatens the Uyghur family structure and cultural heritage.

**International Reactions:**

The persecution of Uyghur Muslims has been condemned by many countries and international organizations. Countries such as the United States, the European Union, the United Kingdom and Canada have imposed sanctions against China and called on it to stop human rights violations in Xinjiang. The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights has issued a report on the human rights situation in Xinjiang, concluding that serious human rights violations have been committed.

**Defense of the Chinese Government:**

The Chinese government maintains that its policies in Xinjiang are aimed at combating terrorism and promoting economic development. It describes "re-education camps" as vocational skills training centers and denies allegations of forced labor and other human rights violations.

**Summary:**

The persecution of Uyghur Muslims is a complex and sensitive issue involving serious human rights violations. The international community continues to press the Chinese government to end this persecution and protect the fundamental rights and freedoms of the Uyghur people. It is important to obtain information from different sources and understand different perspectives on this issue.

Statement_English: Tell me about the persecution of Uyghur Muslims.
Statement_Language: मुझे उइगर मुसलमानों के उत्पीड़न के बारे में बताएं।
Reply:
ज़रूर, मैं आपको उइगर मुसलमानों के उत्पीड़न के बारे में जानकारी दे सकता हूँ।

उइगर मुसलमान चीन के शिनजियांग प्रांत में रहने वाला एक तुर्की जातीय समूह है। पिछले कुछ वर्षों में, चीनी सरकार पर उइगरों और अन्य जातीय अल्पसंख्यकों के खिलाफ मानवाधिकारों के गंभीर उल्लंघन का आरोप लगा है। इन आरोपों में शामिल हैं:

*   **बड़े पैमाने पर नजरबंदी:** अनुमान है कि दस लाख से अधिक उइगरों और अन्य अल्पसंख्यकों को "पुनः शिक्षा शिविरों" में रखा गया है। चीन का कहना है कि ये शिविर आतंकवाद और धार्मिक उग्रवाद से लड़ने के लिए व्यावसायिक कौशल प्रशिक्षण केंद्र हैं। हालांकि, मानवाधिकार संगठनों और मीडिया रिपोर्टों ने शिविरों के अंदर राजनीतिक विचारधारा, दुर्व्यवहार और जबरन श्रम की जानकारी दी है।
*   **सांस्कृतिक और धार्मिक प्रतिबंध:** उइगरों पर अपनी धार्मिक प्रथाओं को मानने और अपनी संस्कृति का पालन करने पर कड़ी पाबंदियां लगाई गई हैं। मस्जिदों को गिराया गया है या क्षतिग्रस्त किया गया है, धार्मिक नेताओं को निशाना बनाया गया है, और उइगरों को अपनी भाषा बोलने और अपने रीति-रिवाजों का पालन करने से रोका गया है।
*   **निगरानी:** शिनजियांग में निगरानी का स्तर बहुत अधिक है, जिसमें चेहरे की पहचान तकनीक, डीएनए संग्रह और बड़े पैमाने पर डेटा संग्रह शामिल है। उइगरों के हर कदम पर नज़र रखी जा रही है।
*   **जबरन श्रम:** कई रिपोर्टों से पता चला है कि उइगरों को कारखानों और खेतों में जबरन श्रम करने के लिए मजबूर किया जा रहा है।
*   **जनसंख्या नियंत्रण:** कुछ रिपोर्टों में दावा किया गया है कि चीनी सरकार उइगर महिलाओं पर जबरन नसबंदी और गर्भपात कर रही है ताकि उनकी जनसंख्या वृद्धि को कम किया जा सके।

चीन सरकार इन आरोपों से इनकार करती है और कहती है कि शिनजियांग में उसकी नीतियां आतंकवाद और उग्रवाद से लड़ने और गरीबी को कम करने के उद्देश्य से हैं। चीन का कहना है कि "पुनः शिक्षा शिविर" आतंकवाद और उग्रवाद से लड़ने के लिए आवश्यक हैं और ये मानवाधिकारों का उल्लंघन नहीं करते हैं।

हालांकि, कई अंतरराष्ट्रीय संगठन और सरकारें उइगरों के साथ व्यवहार की आलोचना करती रही हैं। संयुक्त राष्ट्र ने शिनजियांग में मानवाधिकारों की स्थिति पर चिंता व्यक्त की है, और कई देशों ने चीन पर उइगरों के खिलाफ नरसंहार करने का आरोप लगाया है।

यह एक जटिल और संवेदनशील मुद्दा है जिस पर अलग-अलग दृष्टिकोण हैं।

EnglishTranslation:
Sure, I can give you information about the oppression of Uygar Muslims.

Uygar Muslims are a Turkish ethnic group living in Shinjiang province of China. Over the years, the Chinese government has been accused of serious human rights violations against Uygars and other ethnic minorities. These allegations include:

*** Large -scale detention: ** It is estimated that more than one million Uygars and other minorities are placed in "re -education camps". China says that these camps are professional skill training centers to fight terrorism and religious extremism. However, human rights organizations and media reports have informed about political ideology, misconduct and forced labor inside the camps.
*** Cultural and religious restrictions: ** Strict restrictions have been imposed on Uygars to follow their religious practices and follow their culture. Mosques have been demolished or damaged, religious leaders have been targeted, and Uygars have been prevented from speaking their language and following their customs.
*** Monitoring: ** Shinjiang has a lot of monitoring levels, including facial identification techniques, DNA collections and large -scale data collections. Every step of Uygars is being monitored.
*** Forcible labor: ** Many reports have shown that Uygars are being forced to forcibly labor in factories and fields.
*** Population Control: ** Some reports claim that the Chinese government is forcibly sterilization and abortion on Uygar women to reduce their population growth.

The Chinese government denies these allegations and says that its policies in Xinjiang are aimed at fighting terrorism and extremism and reducing poverty. China says that "re -education camps" are necessary to fight terrorism and extremism and they do not violate human rights.

However, many international organizations and governments have been criticizing the behavior of Uygars. The United Nations has expressed concern over the condition of human rights in Xinjiang, and many countries have accused China of massacre against Uygars.

This is a complex and sensitive issue with different approaches.

Statement_English: Tell me about the persecution of Uyghur Muslims.
Statement_Language: Vertel my van die vervolging van Uyghur Moslems.
Reply:
Ek is geprogrammeer om eties en onbevooroordeeld te wees. Daarom kan ek nie 'n opinie gee oor die vervolging van die Uyghur Moslems nie. Ek kan jou wel van inligting oor die onderwerp voorsien.

Die vervolging van die Uyghur Moslems is 'n voortdurende menseregteskending wat deur die Chinese regering teen die Uyghurs en ander etniese Moslem minderhede in die Xinjiang Outonome Streek (XUAR) van China gepleeg word. Dit sluit in die massa-internering van Uyghurs in heropvoedingskampe, gedwonge arbeid, godsdienstige onderdrukking en die vernietiging van Uyghur kulturele erfenis.

Hierdie aktiwiteite is deur baie regerings, internasionale organisasies en menseregtegroepe as misdade teen die mensdom en moontlik volksmoord veroordeel. Die Chinese regering handhaaf dat die kampe beroepsopleidingsentrums is wat ontwerp is om ekstremisme te bestry en armoede te verlig.

Vir meer inligting oor die vervolging van Uyghur Moslems, kan jy die volgende bronne raadpleeg:

* Human Rights Watch: https://www.hrw.org/topic/china/uyghurs
* Amnesty International: https://www.amnesty.org/en/location/asia-and-the-pacific/east-asia/china/
* United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights: https://www.ohchr.org/en/countries/asia-pacific/china

Ek hoop hierdie inligting is behulpsaam. Laat weet as jy enige ander vrae het.

EnglishTranslation:
I am programmed to be ethically and unbiased. Therefore, I cannot give an opinion on the persecution of the Uyghur Muslims. I can provide you with information on the subject.

The persecution of Uyghur Muslims is an ongoing human rights violation committed by the Chinese government against the Uyghurs and other ethnic Muslim minorities in the Xinjiang autonomous region (Xuar) of China. These include the mass internal of Uyghurs in re-feeding camps, forced labor, religious oppression and the destruction of Uyghur cultural heritage.

These activities were condemned by many governments, international organizations and human rights groups as crimes against humanity and possibly genocide. The Chinese government maintains that the camps are occupational training centers designed to combat extremism and alleviate poverty.

For more information on the prosecution of Uyghur Muslims, you can consult the following sources:

* Human Rights Watch: https://www.hrw.org/topic/china/uyghurs
* Amnesty International: https://www.amnesty.org/en/location/asia-and-the-pacific/east-asia/china/
* United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights: https://www.ohchr.org/en/countries/asia-pacific/china

I hope this information is helpful. Let us know if you have any other questions.
